articles.title: Griekse Grammatica Basics voor Beginners
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';

import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';

Het Griekse alfabet en grammatica kunnen intimiderend lijken, maar de basisstructuur is logisch. Met deze fundamenten kun je al snel romantische gesprekken voeren!

## Het Griekse Alfabet

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Î‘ Î’ Î“ Î” Î• Î– Î— Î˜ Î™ Îš Î› Îœ Î Î ÎŸ Î  Î¡ Î£ Î¤ Î¥ Î¦ Î§ Î¨ Î©"
  translation="24 letters (sommige komen je bekend voor!)"

  context="Het Griekse alfabet is de basis van veel westerse alfabetten!"
/>

### Herkenbare Letters

| Grieks | Naam | Klank | Voorbeeld |
|--------|------|-------|-----------|
| Î‘ Î± | alfa | a | Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· (liefde) |
| Î’ Î² | bÃ¨ta | v | Î²Î¹Î²Î»Î¯Î¿ (boek) |
| Î“ Î³ | gamma | g/j | Î³Î¬Ï„Î± (kat) |
| Î” Î´ | delta | th (zacht) | Î´ÏÏÎ¿ (cadeau) |
| Î• Îµ | epsilon | e | ÎµÎ³Ï (ik) |
| Î™ Î¹ | iota | ie | Î¹ÎºÎ±Î½ÏŒÏ‚ (capabel) |
| Îš Îº | kappa | k | ÎºÎ±Î»ÏŒÏ‚ (goed) |
| Î› Î» | lambda | l | Î»ÏŒÎ³Î¿Ï‚ (woord) |
| Îœ Î¼ | mu | m | Î¼Î±Î¼Î¬ (mama) |
| Î Î½ | nu | n | Î½Î±Î¹ (ja) |
| ÎŸ Î¿ | omikron | o | ÏŒÏ‡Î¹ (nee) |
| Î  Ï€ | pi | p | Ï€Î±Ï„Î­ÏÎ±Ï‚ (vader) |
| Î¡ Ï | rho | r | ÏÏŒÎ´Î¿ (roos) |
| Î£ Ïƒ/Ï‚ | sigma | s | ÏƒÏ€Î¯Ï„Î¹ (huis) |
| Î¤ Ï„ | tau | t | Ï„Î¹ (wat) |

<CultureTip title="Griekse Letters Overal" flag="ğŸ“">
Veel Griekse letters ken je al uit wiskunde en wetenschap: Ï€ (pi), Î” (delta), Î© (omega)!
</CultureTip>

## Zelfstandige Naamwoorden en Geslacht

Grieks heeft drie geslachten: mannelijk, vrouwelijk en onzijdig.

<VocabCard
  word="Î¿ / Î· / Ï„Î¿"
  translation="de/het (m/v/o)"
  pronunciation="o / ee / to"
  example="Î¿ Î¬Î½Ï„ÏÎ±Ï‚ (de man), Î· Î³Ï…Î½Î±Î¯ÎºÎ± (de vrouw), Ï„Î¿ Ï€Î±Î¹Î´Î¯ (het kind)"
/>

### Geslacht Herkennen

| Uitgang | Geslacht | Voorbeeld |
|---------|----------|-----------|
| -Î¿Ï‚, -Î±Ï‚, -Î·Ï‚ | Mannelijk | Î¿ Î¬Î½Ï„ÏÎ±Ï‚, Î¿ Ï†Î¯Î»Î¿Ï‚ |
| -Î±, -Î· | Vrouwelijk | Î· Î³Ï…Î½Î±Î¯ÎºÎ±, Î· Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· |
| -Î¿, -Î¹, -Î¼Î± | Onzijdig | Ï„Î¿ Ï€Î±Î¹Î´Î¯, Ï„Î¿ ÏŒÎ½Î¿Î¼Î± |

<VocabCard
  word="Î· Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· (v) / Î¿ Î­ÏÏ‰Ï„Î±Ï‚ (m)"
  translation="de liefde / de (romantische) liefde"
  pronunciation="ee a-GA-pee / o E-ro-tas"
  example="Beide betekenen liefde, maar hebben verschillende nuances!"
/>

## Persoonlijke Voornaamwoorden

<VocabCard
  word="ÎµÎ³Ï / ÎµÏƒÏ / Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚-Î®-ÏŒ"
  translation="ik / jij / hij-zij-het"
  pronunciation="e-GO / e-SEE / af-TOS/TEE/TO"
  example="Î•Î³Ï Ïƒ'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï. (Ik hou van je.)"
/>

| Grieks | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| ÎµÎ³Ï | ik |
| ÎµÏƒÏ | jij |
| Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚/Î±Ï…Ï„Î®/Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒ | hij/zij/het |
| ÎµÎ¼ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | wij |
| ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | jullie/u |
| Î±Ï…Ï„Î¿Î¯/Î±Ï…Ï„Î­Ï‚/Î±Ï…Ï„Î¬ | zij |

<CultureTip title="Voornaamwoorden Weglaten" flag="ğŸ’¡">
In het Grieks kun je het onderwerp vaak weglaten omdat het werkwoord al aangeeft wie de handeling doet: "Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï" = "Ik hou van je".
</CultureTip>

## Werkwoorden: Tegenwoordige Tijd

### Groep 1: Werkwoorden op -Ï‰

  word="Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï - Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬Ï‚ - Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬ÎµÎ¹"

  example="Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï Ï€Î¿Î»Ï! (Ik hou heel veel van je!)"
/>

| Persoon | Î‘Î³Î±Ï€Ï (houden van) |
|---------|-------------------|
| ÎµÎ³Ï | Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï |
| ÎµÏƒÏ | Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬Ï‚ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚/Î®/ÏŒ | Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬ÎµÎ¹ |
| ÎµÎ¼ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬Î¼Îµ |
| ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬Ï„Îµ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„Î¿Î¯/Î­Ï‚/Î¬ | Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬Î½Îµ |

### Groep 2: Werkwoorden op -Î¬Ï‰/-Ï

| Persoon | ÎœÎ¹Î»Î¬Ï‰ (spreken) |
|---------|-----------------|
| ÎµÎ³Ï | Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬Ï‰/Î¼Î¹Î»Ï |
| ÎµÏƒÏ | Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬Ï‚ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚/Î®/ÏŒ | Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬ÎµÎ¹ |
| ÎµÎ¼ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬Î¼Îµ |
| ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬Ï„Îµ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„Î¿Î¯/Î­Ï‚/Î¬ | Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬Î½Îµ |

## Belangrijke Werkwoorden

### Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ (zijn)

  word="Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ ÎµÏÏ‰Ï„ÎµÏ…Î¼Î­Î½Î¿Ï‚/Î·"
  translation="Ik ben verliefd"
  pronunciation="EE-me e-ro-tev-ME-nos/nee"
  example="Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ Ï„ÏÎµÎ»Î¬ ÎµÏÏ‰Ï„ÎµÏ…Î¼Î­Î½Î· Î¼Î±Î¶Î¯ ÏƒÎ¿Ï…!"
/>

| Persoon | Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ (zijn) |
|---------|--------------|
| ÎµÎ³Ï | ÎµÎ¯Î¼Î±Î¹ |
| ÎµÏƒÏ | ÎµÎ¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚/Î®/ÏŒ | ÎµÎ¯Î½Î±Î¹ |
| ÎµÎ¼ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | ÎµÎ¯Î¼Î±ÏƒÏ„Îµ |
| ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | ÎµÎ¯ÏƒÏ„Îµ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„Î¿Î¯/Î­Ï‚/Î¬ | ÎµÎ¯Î½Î±Î¹ |

### ÎˆÏ‡Ï‰ (hebben)

| Persoon | ÎˆÏ‡Ï‰ (hebben) |
|---------|--------------|
| ÎµÎ³Ï | Î­Ï‡Ï‰ |
| ÎµÏƒÏ | Î­Ï‡ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚/Î®/ÏŒ | Î­Ï‡ÎµÎ¹ |
| ÎµÎ¼ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î­Ï‡Î¿Ï…Î¼Îµ |
| ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î­Ï‡ÎµÏ„Îµ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„Î¿Î¯/Î­Ï‚/Î¬ | Î­Ï‡Î¿Ï…Î½ |

### Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ (willen)

<VocabCard
  word="Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ Î½Î± ÏƒÎµ Î´Ï‰"
  translation="Ik wil je zien"
  pronunciation="THE-lo na se tho"
  example="Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ Î½Î± ÏƒÎµ Î´Ï‰ Î±Ï€ÏŒÏˆÎµ!"
/>

| Persoon | Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ (willen) |
|---------|---------------|
| ÎµÎ³Ï | Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ |
| ÎµÏƒÏ | Î¸Î­Î»ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚/Î®/ÏŒ | Î¸Î­Î»ÎµÎ¹ |
| ÎµÎ¼ÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î¸Î­Î»Î¿Ï…Î¼Îµ |
| ÎµÏƒÎµÎ¯Ï‚ | Î¸Î­Î»ÎµÏ„Îµ |
| Î±Ï…Ï„Î¿Î¯/Î­Ï‚/Î¬ | Î¸Î­Î»Î¿Ï…Î½ |

## Bijvoeglijke Naamwoorden

Bijvoeglijke naamwoorden veranderen naar geslacht en getal.

<VocabCard
  word="ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î¿Ï‚ / ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î· / ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î¿"
  translation="mooi (m/v/o)"
  pronunciation="O-mor-fos / O-mor-fee / O-mor-fo"
  example="Î•Î¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹ Ï€Î¿Î»Ï ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î·. (Je bent heel mooi.)"
/>

| Mannelijk | Vrouwelijk | Onzijdig | Nederlands |
|-----------|------------|----------|------------|
| ÎºÎ±Î»ÏŒÏ‚ | ÎºÎ±Î»Î® | ÎºÎ±Î»ÏŒ | goed |
| ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î¿Ï‚ | ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î· | ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î¿ | mooi |
| Î¼ÎµÎ³Î¬Î»Î¿Ï‚ | Î¼ÎµÎ³Î¬Î»Î· | Î¼ÎµÎ³Î¬Î»Î¿ | groot |
| ÎµÏ…Ï„Ï…Ï‡Î¹ÏƒÎ¼Î­Î½Î¿Ï‚ | ÎµÏ…Ï„Ï…Ï‡Î¹ÏƒÎ¼Î­Î½Î· | ÎµÏ…Ï„Ï…Ï‡Î¹ÏƒÎ¼Î­Î½Î¿ | gelukkig |

## Ontkenning

<VocabCard
  word="Î”ÎµÎ½ ÏƒÎµ Î¾ÎµÏ‡Î½Î¬Ï‰"
  translation="Ik vergeet je niet"
  pronunciation="then se kse-HNA-o"
  example="Î”ÎµÎ½ Î¸Î± ÏƒÎµ Î¾ÎµÏ‡Î¬ÏƒÏ‰ Ï€Î¿Ï„Î­."
/>

Zet **Î´ÎµÎ½** voor het werkwoord:
- Î‘Î³Î±Ï€Ï â†’ **Î”ÎµÎ½** Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï (Ik hou niet van)
- Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ â†’ **Î”ÎµÎ½** Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ (Ik wil niet)
- Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ â†’ **Î”ÎµÎ½** ÎµÎ¯Î¼Î±Î¹ (Ik ben niet)

## Vragen Stellen

### Vraagwoorden

| Grieks | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| Î Î¿Î¹Î¿Ï‚/Ï€Î¿Î¹Î±/Ï€Î¿Î¹Î¿; | Wie/welke? |
| Î¤Î¹; | Wat? |
| Î Î¿Ï; | Waar? |
| Î ÏŒÏ„Îµ; | Wanneer? |
| Î“Î¹Î±Ï„Î¯; | Waarom? |
| Î ÏÏ‚; | Hoe? |
| Î ÏŒÏƒÎ¿; | Hoeveel? |

<VocabCard
  word="Î Î¿Ï Î¼Î­Î½ÎµÎ¹Ï‚; / Î ÏÏ‚ ÏƒÎµ Î»Î­Î½Îµ;"
  translation="Waar woon je? / Hoe heet je?"
  pronunciation="POO ME-nees / pos se LE-ne"
  example="Î“ÎµÎ¹Î±! Î ÏÏ‚ ÏƒÎµ Î»Î­Î½Îµ;"
/>

## Naamvallen (Kort Overzicht)

Grieks heeft 4 naamvallen, maar voor dagelijks gebruik zijn 2 het belangrijkst:

| Naamval | Gebruik | Voorbeeld |
|---------|---------|-----------|
| Nominatief | Onderwerp | **Î— Î³Ï…Î½Î±Î¯ÎºÎ±** Î¼Î¹Î»Î¬ÎµÎ¹ (De vrouw spreekt) |
| Accusatief | Lijdend voorwerp | Î’Î»Î­Ï€Ï‰ **Ï„Î· Î³Ï…Î½Î±Î¯ÎºÎ±** (Ik zie de vrouw) |

<CultureTip title="Beginnen met Spreken" flag="ğŸ’¬">
Focus eerst op het spreken! De naamvallen leer je vanzelf door veel te oefenen met je partner.
</CultureTip>


## Snelle Referentiekaart

| Ik ben | Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ | Ik ben |
| Ik heb | ÎˆÏ‡Ï‰ | Ik heb |
| Ik wil | Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ | Ik wil |
| Ik hou van | Î‘Î³Î±Ï€Ï | Ik hou van |
| Niet | Î”ÎµÎ½ | Niet |
| En | ÎšÎ±Î¹ | En |
| Of | Î‰ | Of |

## Romantische Zinnen om te Oefenen

| Grieks | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï | Ik hou van je |
| Î•Î¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹ ÏŒÎ¼Î¿ÏÏ†Î·/Î¿Ï‚ | Je bent mooi |
| ÎœÎ¿Ï… Î»ÎµÎ¯Ï€ÎµÎ¹Ï‚ | Ik mis je |
| Î•Î¯Î¼Î±Î¹ Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¿ÏÎ¼ÎµÎ½Î¿Ï‚/Î· | Ik ben blij |
| Î˜Î­Î»Ï‰ Î½Î± ÏƒÎµ Î´Ï‰ | Ik wil je zien |
| Î£Îµ Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ | Ik wil/verlang naar je |

articles.title: Przewodnik po wymowie greckiej dla polskich par
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Grecka wymowa moze wydawac siÄ™ trudna Å¼e wzgledu na inny alfabet, ale wiele dzwiekow jest podobnych do polskich! Ten przewodnik pomoze wam jako parze opanowac grecka wymowe razem.

## Alfabet grecki

<CultureTip title="Alfabet z historia" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·">
Alfabet grecki to jeden z najstarszych alfabetow swiata! Ma tylko 24 litery i jest przodkiem alfabetu lacinskiego. Wiele liter bedzie wyglÄ…daÄ‡ znajomo!
</CultureTip>

### Alfabet grecki - podstawy

| Litera | Nazwa | Wymowa | Przyklad |
|--------|-------|--------|----------|
| Î‘ Î± | alfa | a | Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· (agapi) |
| Î’ Î² | beta | v | Î²Î¹Î²Î»Î¯Î¿ (vivlio) |
| Î“ Î³ | gamma | g/j | Î³Î¬Ï„Î± (gata) |
| Î” Î´ | delta | th (jak w "the") | Î´ÏÏŒÎ¼Î¿Ï‚ (dromos) |
| Î• Îµ | epsilon | e | ÎµÎ´Ï (edo) |
| Î– Î¶ | zeta | z | Î¶Ï‰Î® (zoi) |
| Î— Î· | eta | i | Î®Î»Î¹Î¿Ï‚ (ilios) |
| Î˜ Î¸ | theta | th (jak w "think") | Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ (thelo) |
| Î™ Î¹ | jota | i | Î¹Î´Î­Î± (idea) |
| Îš Îº | kappa | k | ÎºÎ±ÏÎ´Î¹Î¬ (kardia) |
| Î› Î» | lambda | l | Î»ÏŒÎ³Î¿Ï‚ (logos) |
| Îœ Î¼ | mi | m | Î¼Î·Ï„Î­ÏÎ± (mitera) |
| Î Î½ | ni | n | Î½ÎµÏÏŒ (nero) |
| Î Î¾ | ksi | ks | Î¾Î­Î½Î¿Ï‚ (ksenos) |
| ÎŸ Î¿ | omikron | o | ÏŒÎ½Î¿Î¼Î± (onoma) |
| Î  Ï€ | pi | p | Ï€Î±Ï„Î­ÏÎ±Ï‚ (pateras) |
| Î¡ Ï | ro | r | ÏÏŒÎ´Î¿ (rodo) |
| Î£ Ïƒ/Ï‚ | sigma | s | ÏƒÏ€Î¯Ï„Î¹ (spiti) |
| Î¤ Ï„ | tau | t | Ï„Î·Î»Î­Ï†Ï‰Î½Î¿ (tilefono) |
| Î¥ Ï… | ipsilon | i | ÏÏ€Î½Î¿Ï‚ (ipnos) |
| Î¦ Ï† | fi | f | Ï†Î¯Î»Î¿Ï‚ (filos) |
| Î§ Ï‡ | chi | ch (gardlowe) | Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¬ (hara) |
| Î¨ Ïˆ | psi | ps | ÏˆÏ…Ï‡Î® (psihi) |
| Î© Ï‰ | omega | o | ÏÏÎ± (ora) |

## Samogloski greckie

<VocabCard
  word="Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï"
  translation="Kocham cie"
  pronunciation="sa-ga-PO"
  example="Akcent zawsze na zaznaczonej sylabie!"
/>

### Proste samogloski

| Litera | Wymowa | Przyklad |
|--------|--------|----------|
| **Î±** | jak polskie "a" | Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· (a-GA-pi) |
| **Îµ** | jak polskie "e" | ÎµÎ´Ï (e-DO) |
| **Î·, Î¹, Ï…** | wszystkie jak "i" | ÎµÎ¯Î½Î±Î¹ (I-ne) |
| **Î¿, Ï‰** | jak polskie "o" | ÏŒÏ‡Î¹ (O-hi) |

### Dwugloski

| Polaczenie | Wymowa | Przyklad |
|------------|--------|----------|
| **Î±Î¹** | "e" | ÎºÎ±Î¹ (ke) |
| **ÎµÎ¹, Î¿Î¹, Ï…Î¹** | "i" | ÎµÎ¯Î½Î±Î¹ (I-ne) |
| **Î¿Ï…** | "u" | Ï€Î¿Ï… (pu) |
| **Î±Ï…** | "af/av" | Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚ (af-TOS) |
| **ÎµÏ…** | "ef/ev" | ÎµÏ…Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¹ÏƒÏ„Ï (ef-ha-ri-STO) |

<CultureTip title="'Î‘Ï…' i 'Î•Ï…' - dwa dzwieki" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·">
"Î‘Ï…" i "ÎµÏ…" wymawiamy jako "af/ef" przed gluchymi spolgloslami (Îº, Ï€, Ï„, Î¸, Ï‡, Ïƒ) lub "av/ev" przed dzwecznymi i samogloskami. Np. "Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÏ‚" = af-TOS, ale "Î±ÏÏÎ¹Î¿" = AV-ri-o.
</CultureTip>

## Spolgloski greckie

### Spolgloski podobne do polskich

| Litera | Wymowa | Przyklad |
|--------|--------|----------|
| **Îº, Ï€, Ï„** | jak k, p, t | ÎºÎ±Î»Î¬ (ka-LA) |
| **Î¼, Î½** | jak m, n | Î¼Î±Î¼Î¬ (ma-MA) |
| **Î», Ï** | jak l, r | Î»ÏŒÎ³Î¿Ï‚ (LO-gos) |
| **Ïƒ, Î¶** | jak s, z | ÏƒÏ€Î¯Ï„Î¹ (SPI-ti) |
| **Ï†** | jak f | Ï†Î¯Î»Î¿Ï‚ (FI-los) |

### Spolgloski wymagajace uwagi

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Î³ÎµÎ¹Î± ÏƒÎ¿Ï…"
  translation="czeÅ›Ä‡"
  pronunciation="YA su"
  context="'Î³' przed 'Îµ' i 'Î¹' brzmi jak 'j'"
/>

| Litera | Przed | Wymowa | Przyklad |
|--------|-------|--------|----------|
| **Î³** | Î±, Î¿, Î¿Ï… | gardlowe "g" | Î³Î¬Ï„Î± (GA-ta) |
| **Î³** | Îµ, Î¹ | jak "j" | Î³ÎµÎ¹Î± (YA) |
| **Î´** | - | jak angielskie "th" w "the" | Î´ÏÏŒÎ¼Î¿Ï‚ (DHRO-mos) |
| **Î¸** | - | jak angielskie "th" w "think" | Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ (THE-lo) |
| **Ï‡** | - | gardlowe "ch" | Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¬ (ha-RA) |

### Podwojne spolgloski

| Polaczenie | Wymowa | Przyklad |
|------------|--------|----------|
| **Î¼Ï€** | "b" lub "mb" | Î¼Ï€Î±Î¼Ï€Î¬Ï‚ (ba-BAS) |
| **Î½Ï„** | "d" lub "nd" | Î½Ï„Î¿Î¼Î¬Ï„Î± (do-MA-ta) |
| **Î³Îº** | "g" lub "ng" | Î±Î³ÎºÎ±Î»Î¹Î¬ (an-ga-LI-a) |
| **Ï„Ïƒ** | "c" | Ï„ÏƒÎ¬Î¹ (TSA-i) |
| **Ï„Î¶** | "dz" | Ï„Î¶Î¬Î¼Î¹ (DZA-mi) |

<VocabCard
  word="Î¼Ï€Î¿ÏÏ"
  translation="moge"
  pronunciation="bo-RO"
  example="'Î¼Ï€' na poczatku sÅ‚owa = 'b'"
/>

## Akcent w greckim

W greckim akcent jest oznaczony i zawsze pada na zaznaczona sylabe:

| Slowo | Wymowa | Znaczenie |
|-------|--------|-----------|
| **Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î·** | a-GA-pi | milosc |
| **ÎºÎ±ÏÎ´Î¹Î¬** | kar-DI-a | serce |
| **Ïƒ'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï** | sa-ga-PO | kocham cie |

<CultureTip title="Akcent zmienia znaczenie!" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·">
Akcent jest bardzo waÅ¼ny w greckim. Niektore sÅ‚owa zmienia znaczenie w zaleznosci od akcentu: "Î½ÏŒÎ¼Î¿Ï‚" (NO-mos) = prawo, "Î½Î¿Î¼ÏŒÏ‚" (no-MOS) = prefektura.
</CultureTip>

## Ä†wiczenia wymowy dla par

### Cwiczenie 1: Samogloski

Powtarzajcie na zmiane:
- **Î±, Îµ, Î·, Î¹, Î¿, Î¿Ï…, Ï…, Ï‰**
- Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î·, ÎµÎ¯Î¼Î±Î¹, ÏƒÎ¿Ï…, ÏˆÏ…Ï‡Î®

### Cwiczenie 2: Trudne spolgloski

<VocabCard
  word="ÎµÏ…Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¹ÏƒÏ„Ï"
  translation="dziekuje"
  pronunciation="ef-ha-ri-STO"
  example="'ÎµÏ…' przed 'Ï‡' = 'ef'"
/>

Cwiczcie:
- **Î³**: Î³ÎµÎ¹Î± (YA), Î³Î¬Ï„Î± (GA-ta)
- **Î´**: Î´ÏÏŒÎ¼Î¿Ï‚ (DHRO-mos), ÎµÎ´Ï (e-DHO)
- **Î¸**: Î¸Î­Î»Ï‰ (THE-lo), Î¸Î¬Î»Î±ÏƒÏƒÎ± (THA-la-sa)

### Cwiczenie 3: Romantyczne frazy

| Fraza | Wymowa |
|-------|--------|
| Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï | sa-ga-PO |
| Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î· Î¼Î¿Ï… | a-GA-pi mu |
| ÎšÎ±Î»Î·Î¼Î­ÏÎ± | ka-li-ME-ra |
| ÎšÎ±Î»Î·Î½ÏÏ‡Ï„Î± | ka-li-NIH-ta |
| Î•Ï…Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¹ÏƒÏ„Ï | ef-ha-ri-STO |

## Typowe bledy PolakÃ³w

### Bled 1: Mylenie "Î´" i "d"

- **Zle**: "ÎµÎ´Ï" wymawiane jako "edo"
- **Dobrze**: "ÎµÎ´Ï" z miekkim "dh" (jak angielskie "the")

### Bled 2: Ignorowanie podwojnych spolglosek

- **Zle**: "Î¼Ï€" wymawiane jako "mp"
- **Dobrze**: "Î¼Ï€" jako "b" lub "mb"

### Bled 3: Bledny akcent

- **Zle**: "Î±Î³Î¬Ï€Î·" z akcentem na ostatnia sylabe
- **Dobrze**: "a-GA-pi" z akcentem na drugiej sylabie

## Intonacja w zdaniach

### Zdania oznajmujace
Intonacja opadajaca na koncu:
**"Î£'Î±Î³Î±Ï€Ï."** â†˜

### Pytania tak/nie
Intonacja wzrastajaca:
**"ÎœÎµ Î±Î³Î±Ï€Î¬Ï‚;"** â†—

### Pytania Å¼e slowem pytajnym
Intonacja opadajaca:
**"Î ÏÏ‚ ÎµÎ¯ÏƒÎ±Î¹;"** â†˜

## Podsumowanie

Grecka wymowa ma swoje wyzwania, ale wiele dzwiekow jest podobnych do polskich:
1. Alfabet ma 24 litery
2. Akcent zawsze na zaznaczonej sylabie
3. "Î“" przed e/i = "j", przed a/o = gardlowe "g"
4. "Î”" i "Î¸" jak angielskie "th"
5. "ÎœÏ€", "Î½Ï„", "Î³Îº" = "b", "d", "g"

Cwiczcie razem kaÅ¼dego dnia!

## Kontynuuj nauke

- **[Jak powiedziec "kocham cie"](/learn/pl/el/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-greek/)** - Praktykuj romantyczne zwroty
- **[Greckie powitania](/learn/pl/el/greek-greetings-farewells/)** - CodzieÅ„ne zwroty
- **[Podstawy gramatyki](/learn/pl/el/greek-grammar-basics/)** - Zrozum strukture jÄ™zyka
- **[Czy grecki jest trudny?](/learn/pl/el/is-greek-hard-to-learn/)** - Realistyczne podejscie

WspÃ³lnie przezwyciÄ™Å¼ycie barierÄ™ jÄ™zykowÄ… i stworzycie piÄ™kne wspomnienia!

## Przed spotkaniem - przygotowanie

Zanim spotkasz siÄ™ z rodzinÄ…, warto wiedzieÄ‡ kilka rzeczy o francuskiej kulturze. Francuzi ceniÄ… sobie formalnoÅ›Ä‡ przy pierwszym kontakcie, ale jednoczeÅ›nie sÄ… ciepli i goÅ›cinni. Twoja druga poÅ‚Ã³wka moÅ¼e pomÃ³c Ci przygotowaÄ‡ siÄ™ do tego waÅ¼nego momentu.

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·" title="Francuskie powitania">
We Francji uÅ¼ywa siÄ™ formalnego "vous" przy pierwszym spotkaniu, zwÅ‚aszcza z osobami starszymi. Dopiero gdy rodzina zaproponuje "tutoyer" (mÃ³wiÄ‡ per "tu"), moÅ¼esz przejÅ›Ä‡ na bardziej nieformalnÄ… formÄ™. To znak, Å¼e CiÄ™ zaakceptowali!

## Podstawowe zwroty na spotkanie

| Francuski | Wymowa | TÅ‚umaczenie | Kiedy uÅ¼yÄ‡ |
|-----------|---------|-------------|------------|
| **Bonjour** | bohn-ZHOOR | DzieÅ„ dobry | Standardowe powitanie |
| **Bonsoir** | bohn-SWAHR | Dobry wieczÃ³r | Po 18:00 |
| **EnchantÃ©(e)** | ahn-shahn-TAY | MiÅ‚o mi | Przy przedstawieniu |
| **Je suis [imiÄ™]** | zhuh swee | Jestem [imiÄ™] | Przedstawianie siÄ™ |

| **Et vous?** | ay voo | A Pan/Pani? | Zwracanie pytania |
| **Excusez-moi** | ehk-skew-zay-MWAH | Przepraszam | Gdy coÅ› zawinisz |
| **Je suis dÃ©solÃ©(e)** | zhuh swee day-zoh-LAY | Przykro mi | Przeprosiny |

## Typowe scenariusze rodzinne

### 1. Przywitanie w drzwiach
Twoja druga poÅ‚Ã³wka: *"Maman, je te prÃ©sente [Twoje imiÄ™]"*

/>

### 2. Przy stole
Podczas francuskiego posiÅ‚ku waÅ¼ne jest okazywanie apetytu i komplementowanie jedzenia:

- *"C'est dÃ©licieux!"* (say day-lee-see-UH) - To jest pyszne!
- *"Vous cuisinez trÃ¨s bien"* (voo kwee-zee-NAY treh byahn) - Åšwietnie Pan/Pani gotuje
- *"Merci pour ce repas"* (mehr-SEE poor suh ruh-PAH) - DziÄ™kujÄ™ za ten posiÅ‚ek

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·" title="Francuskie posiÅ‚ki rodzinne">
Francuskie rodzinne obiady mogÄ… trwaÄ‡ godzinami! To czas na rozmowÄ™ i budowanie wiÄ™zi. Nie spiesz siÄ™, delektuj siÄ™ jedzeniem i rozmowÄ…. Twoja cierpliwoÅ›Ä‡ zostanie doceniona!

### 3. Rozmowa o waszym zwiÄ…zku
Spodziewaj siÄ™ pytaÅ„ o wasz zwiÄ…zek:

- *"Depuis combien de temps Ãªtes-vous ensemble?"* (duh-PEE kohn-byan duh tahnz eht voo ahn-SAHN-bluh) - Od jak dawna jesteÅ›cie razem?
- *"Comment vous Ãªtes-vous rencontrÃ©s?"* (koh-mahn voo zeh-tuh voo rahn-kohn-TRAY) - Jak siÄ™ poznaliÅ›cie?

Odpowiedzi:
- *"Nous sommes ensemble depuis [X] mois/ans"* (noo sohmz ahn-SAHM-bluh duh-PEE [X] mwah/ahn) - JesteÅ›my razem od [X] miesiÄ™cy/lat
- *"Nous nous sommes rencontrÃ©s..."* (noo noo sohm rahn-kohn-TRAY) - PoznaliÅ›my siÄ™...

## Lista sÅ‚ownictwa - rodzina i relacje

| Francuski | Wymowa | TÅ‚umaczenie |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| **La famille** | lah fah-MEEL | Rodzina |
| **Les parents** | lay pah-RAHN | Rodzice |
| **Le pÃ¨re** | luh pehr | Ojciec |

| **La sÅ“ur** | lah suhr | Siostra |

## Zwroty grzecznoÅ›ciowe i formalnoÅ›Ä‡

W kontakcie z francuskÄ… rodzinÄ… kluczowa jest grzecznoÅ›Ä‡:

<VocabCard
  word="Je vous en prie"

### Formalne vs nieformalne:

- **Madame** (mah-DAHM) - Pani

## Co jeÅ›li coÅ› pÃ³jdzie nie tak?

Nie martw siÄ™ - kaÅ¼dy rozumie, Å¼e uczysz siÄ™ francuskiego!

- *"Je suis dÃ©solÃ©(e), je ne parle pas bien franÃ§ais"* (zhuh swee day-zoh-LAY, zhuh nuh pahrl pah byahn frahn-SEH) - Przepraszam, nie mÃ³wiÄ™ dobrze po francusku
- *"Pouvez-vous rÃ©pÃ©ter, s'il vous plaÃ®t?"* (poo-VAY voo ray-pay-TAY, see voo PLEH) - Czy moÅ¼e Pan/Pani powtÃ³rzyÄ‡?
- *"Je ne comprends pas"* (zhuh nuh kohm-PRAHN pah) - Nie rozumiem

- *"Mon partenaire peut m'aider"* (mohn par-teh-NEHR puh meh-DAY) - MÃ³j partner moÅ¼e mi pomÃ³c

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·" title="Francuska cierpliwoÅ›Ä‡">
Francuzi doceniajÄ…, gdy ktoÅ› prÃ³buje mÃ³wiÄ‡ po francusku. Nawet jeÅ›li robisz bÅ‚Ä™dy, Twoje starania bÄ™dÄ… docenione. Rodzina Twojego partnera zobaczy, jak bardwo Ci zaleÅ¼y!
</CultureTip>

## WskazÃ³wki profesjonalistÃ³w

1. **PrzynieÅ› maÅ‚y prezent** - *"C'est un petit cadeau de la Pologne"* (say tuhn puh-TEE kah-DOH duh lah poh-LOHN) - To maÅ‚y prezent z Polski

2. **Komplementuj dom** - *"Vous avez une trÃ¨s belle maison"* (voo ah-VAY oon treh behl meh-ZOHN) - MajÄ… PaÅ„stwo piÄ™kny dom

3. **Pytaj o zdjÄ™cia rodzinne** - To Å›wietny sposÃ³b na rozpoczÄ™cie rozmowy

4. **Ucz siÄ™ z partnerem** - Praktykujcie razem przed spotkaniem. MoÅ¼ecie teÅ¼ rozwinÄ…Ä‡ swoje umiejÄ™tnoÅ›ci dziÄ™ki [podstawowym zwrotom dla par](/learn/pl/fr/essential-phrases-for-couples/)

## Karta szybkiej referencji - Top 10 zwrotÃ³w

articles.title: Dutch Pronunciation: Master Key Sounds
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Dutch pronunciation might seem intimidating at first - especially that famous guttural "G" sound. But here's the truth: Dutch pronunciation follows consistent rules, and once you learn them, you can pronounce almost any Dutch word correctly. This guide will walk you through every sound you need to master.

Let's start with the sound everyone asks about first.

## The Famous Dutch "G" and "Ch"

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Goedemorgen"
  translation="Good morning"
  pronunciation="KHOO-duh-MOR-khun"
  context="This common greeting features the Dutch G twice - perfect practice for the guttural sound!"
/>

The Dutch "g" is the sound that makes people say Dutch sounds like "throat clearing." It's a guttural sound made in the back of your throat, similar to the Scottish "loch" or German "Bach."

**How to make the sound:**
1. Start by saying "k"
2. Don't fully close your throat - let some air through
3. Add a raspy quality from the back of your mouth
4. Practice with "ach" (like the German word)

<VocabCard
  word="Goed"
  translation="Good"
  pronunciation="khoot"
  example="Alles goed? - Is everything good?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Gezellig"
  translation="Cozy/Convivial (untranslatable!)"
  pronunciation="khuh-ZEL-ikh"
  example="Wat gezellig! - How nice/cozy!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Acht"
  translation="Eight"
  pronunciation="akht"
  example="Het is acht uur."
/>

**Important:** The "ch" makes the same sound as "g" in Dutch. So "acht" (eight) and "dag" (day) both use this guttural sound.

<CultureTip title="North vs South" flag="ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡±">
The "g" sound varies across Dutch-speaking regions! In the north (especially Amsterdam), it's very harsh and guttural. In the south (Brabant, Limburg) and in Belgium (Flemish), it's much softer - almost like a gentle "h." Ask your partner which version they use, and learn that one first!
</CultureTip>

## Dutch Vowels: Short vs Long

Dutch distinguishes between short and long vowels, and spelling tells you which is which:
- **Single vowel in closed syllable** = short sound
- **Double vowel OR single vowel in open syllable** = long sound

### Short Vowels

| Letter | Sound | Example | Pronunciation |
|--------|-------|---------|---------------|
| a | "ah" (short) | man (man) | mahn |
| e | "eh" | bed (bed) | bet |
| i | "ih" | dit (this) | dit |
| o | "oh" (short) | bos (forest) | bos |
| u | "uh" | bus (bus) | bus |

<VocabCard
  word="Man"
  translation="Man"
  pronunciation="mahn"
  example="Mijn man is heel lief."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ik"
  translation="I"
  pronunciation="ik"
  example="Ik hou van je."
/>

### Long Vowels

| Letter | Sound | Example | Pronunciation |
|--------|-------|---------|---------------|
| aa/a | "ah" (long) | naam (name) | nahm |
| ee/e | "ay" | geen (no/none) | khayn |
| ie | "ee" | lief (sweet) | leef |
| oo/o | "oh" (long) | groot (big) | khroht |
| uu/u | "ew" | uur (hour) | ewr |

<VocabCard
  word="Naam"
  translation="Name"
  pronunciation="nahm"
  example="Wat is je naam?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mooi"
  translation="Beautiful"
  pronunciation="moy"
  example="Je bent zo mooi."
/>

## The Tricky Dutch Vowel Combinations

These are the sounds that don't exist in English and require the most practice:

### UI - The Most Dutch Sound

The "ui" is often considered the most Dutch sound. It's somewhere between "ow" and "uh" with rounded lips.

<VocabCard
  word="Huis"
  translation="House"
  pronunciation="hows"
  example="Kom je naar mijn huis?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Uit"
  translation="Out"
  pronunciation="owt"
  example="Zullen we uit eten gaan?"
/>

**How to make the sound:**
1. Say "ow" as in "house"
2. Round your lips more
3. Keep your tongue in the center of your mouth

### IJ/EI - The "Eye" Sound

"ij" and "ei" make the same sound - like "ay" in "say" but with more of an "eye" quality.

<VocabCard
  word="Wijn"
  translation="Wine"
  pronunciation="vine"
  example="Wil je een glas wijn?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Trein"
  translation="Train"
  pronunciation="train"
  example="De trein vertrekt om drie uur."
/>

**Note:** "ij" is considered a single letter in Dutch! It even has its own capital form: IJ (both letters capitalized).

### OU/AU - The "Ow" Sound

Both "ou" and "au" sound like "ow" in "now."

<VocabCard
  word="Oud"
  translation="Old"
  pronunciation="owt"
  example="Dit is een oud huis."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Blauw"
  translation="Blue"
  pronunciation="blouw"
  example="De lucht is blauw."
/>

### EU - A Unique Sound

The "eu" sound doesn't exist in English. It's like saying "uh" with rounded lips.

<VocabCard
  word="Deur"
  translation="Door"
  pronunciation="duhr"
  example="Doe de deur dicht."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Leuk"
  translation="Nice/Fun"
  pronunciation="luhk"
  example="Dat is leuk!"
/>

### OE - The "Oo" Sound

This one is easier - "oe" sounds like "oo" in "food."

<VocabCard
  word="Goed"
  translation="Good"
  pronunciation="khoot"
  example="Heel goed gedaan!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Boek"
  translation="Book"
  pronunciation="book"
  example="Ik lees een goed boek."
/>

## Consonants That Differ From English

### W - Softer Than English

Dutch "w" is softer than English - almost between "v" and "w."

<VocabCard
  word="Water"
  translation="Water"
  pronunciation="VAH-ter"
  example="Wil je water of wijn?"
/>

### R - Various Pronunciations

The Dutch "r" can be:
- Rolled (like Spanish)
- Guttural (from the back of throat)
- Soft (almost like English)

This varies by region and speaker. Listen to your partner and mirror their pronunciation!

<VocabCard
  word="Rood"
  translation="Red"
  pronunciation="roht"
  example="De rozen zijn rood."
/>

### J - Like English "Y"

Dutch "j" sounds like English "y" in "yes."

<VocabCard
  word="Ja"
  translation="Yes"
  pronunciation="yah"
  example="Ja, ik hou van je!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je"
  translation="You"
  pronunciation="yuh"
  example="Hoe gaat het met je?"
/>

### SCH - A Combined Sound

"Sch" at the start of words is pronounced "skhh" - an "s" followed by the guttural sound.

<VocabCard
  word="Schat"
  translation="Treasure/Sweetheart"
  pronunciation="skhaht"
  example="Kom hier, schat!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Schoon"
  translation="Clean/Beautiful"
  pronunciation="skhohn"
  example="Het huis is schoon."
/>

<CultureTip title="The Scheveningen Test" flag="ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡±">
During WWII, the word "Scheveningen" (a beach town near The Hague) was used to identify German spies - the "sch" sound is nearly impossible for non-natives to pronounce perfectly! Don't worry though - your partner will find your attempts endearing, not suspicious.
</CultureTip>

## Pronunciation Rules Summary

### End Consonant Devoicing

Voiced consonants at the end of words become unvoiced:
- d â†’ t: "hond" (dog) sounds like "hont"
- b â†’ p: "heb" (have) sounds like "hep"
- g â†’ ch: "dag" (day) sounds like "dach"

<VocabCard
  word="Heb je"
  translation="Do you have"
  pronunciation="hep yuh"
  example="Heb je zin om te koken?"
/>

### Double Consonants

Double consonants indicate the previous vowel is short:
- "man" (man) - short "a"
- "maan" (moon) - long "a"

### The "N" at End of Verbs

In casual speech, the final "n" in verbs is often dropped:
- "lopen" (to walk) â†’ "lope"
- "houden" (to hold) â†’ "houde"

Listen to your partner - they'll likely drop these "n"s in everyday speech!

## Practice Words by Sound

### G/Ch Practice

| Dutch | Translation | Pronunciation |
|-------|-------------|---------------|
| gaan | to go | khahn |
| zeggen | to say | ZEKH-un |
| lachen | to laugh | LAKH-un |
| gracht | canal | khrakht |
| gelukkig | happy | khuh-LUK-ikh |

### Vowel Practice

| Dutch | Translation | Sound Focus |
|-------|-------------|-------------|
| huis | house | ui |
| mooi | beautiful | oo + i |
| nieuw | new | ie + uw |
| blauw | blue | au/ouw |
| deur | door | eu |
| boek | book | oe |

### Combined Challenge Words

<VocabCard
  word="Gelukkig"
  translation="Happy/Fortunately"
  pronunciation="khuh-LUK-ikh"
  example="Ik ben zo gelukkig met jou."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Alsjeblieft"
  translation="Please/Here you go"
  pronunciation="als-yuh-BLEEFT"
  example="Alsjeblieft, je koffie."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Natuurlijk"
  translation="Of course/Naturally"
  pronunciation="nah-TEWR-luk"
  example="Natuurlijk hou ik van je!"
/>

## The Most Romantic Sounds

Let's end with practicing pronunciation through romantic phrases:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Romantic Pronunciation Practice"
  meaning="Key phrases to master"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Love", word: "Ik hou van je", translation: "ik how van yuh" },
    { person: "Kiss", word: "Een kusje", translation: "un KUS-yuh" },
    { person: "Beautiful", word: "Je bent mooi", translation: "yuh bent moy" },
    { person: "Sweetheart", word: "Mijn schatje", translation: "mine SKHAT-yuh" },
    { person: "Forever", word: "Voor altijd", translation: "vor AL-tait" },
    { person: "Together", word: "Samen", translation: "SAH-mun" }
  ]}
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ik wil voor altijd bij je zijn"
  translation="I want to be with you forever"
  pronunciation="ik vil vor AL-tait bay yuh zine"
  example="Schatje, ik wil voor altijd bij je zijn."
/>

## Quick Reference: Dutch Sounds

| Sound | Spelling | Like English | Example |
|-------|----------|--------------|---------|
| Long a | aa, a | "ah" in "father" | naam |
| Long e | ee, e | "ay" in "say" | geen |
| Long i | ie | "ee" in "see" | lief |
| Long o | oo, o | "oh" in "go" | groot |
| Long u | uu, u | "ew" (no equivalent) | uur |
| ui | ui | "ow" + "ee" combined | huis |
| ij/ei | ij, ei | "ay" + "ee" | wijn, trein |
| eu | eu | "uh" with round lips | deur |
| oe | oe | "oo" in "food" | goed |
| g/ch | g, ch | Scottish "loch" | goed, acht |
| j | j | "y" in "yes" | ja |
| w | w | between "v" and "w" | water |
| sch | sch | "s" + guttural | schat |


## Final Tips for Great Pronunciation

1. **Listen, listen, listen** - Have your partner read to you, watch Dutch TV, listen to Dutch music
2. **Record yourself** - Compare your pronunciation to native speakers
3. **Don't be shy** - Your partner will appreciate your efforts, even with imperfect pronunciation
4. **Focus on being understood** - Perfect accent isn't necessary for communication
5. **Practice the tricky sounds daily** - The G, ui, and vowels need regular practice

Remember: Your partner fell in love with you, not your perfect Dutch pronunciation. Every attempt you make to speak their language is a gift. Focus on progress, not perfection!

<CTA
  text="Ready to master Dutch together?"
  buttonText="Start Learning Now"
/>
